# Task

You are given a DataFrame `df_cars` with car data with columns `manufacturer` and `model`. Write a function audi_filter that filters down the dataset to only the rows with manufacturer “audi” and model being “a4 or “a4 quattro”, then it should create a new column `audi_a4_type` that equals `true` across all rows. Then return the resulting DataFrame.



# Data

df_cars = DataFrame(manufacturer=["audi", "audi", "bmw", "audi", "audi", "ford", "audi", "audi", "toyota", "audi"],
    model=["a4", "a6", "3 series", "a4 quattro", "q7", "fusion", "tt", "a4", "corolla", "a4 quattro"])
audi_filter(df_cars)

# Function Definition
```julia
function audi_filter(df::DataFrame)
    # Filtering for Audi cars
    df_audi = filter(row -> row.manufacturer == "audi", df)
    # Filtering for A4 and A4 quattro models
    df_a4 = filter(row -> occursin("a4", row.model), df_audi)
    
    # Creating a new column indicating it's an Audi A4 or A4 quattro
    for i in eachindex(df_a4.model)
        if df_a4[i, :model] == "a4"
            df_a4[i, :audi_a4_type] = true
        elseif df_a4[i, :model] == "a4 quattro"
            df_a4[i, :audi_a4_type] = true
        end
    end
    
    # Returning the resulting DataFrame
    return df_a4
end
```

# Applying the Function to the Provided Data
```julia
using DataFrames

df_cars = DataFrame(manufacturer=["audi", "audi", "bmw", "audi", "audi", "ford", "audi", "audi", "toyota", "audi"],
    model=["a4", "a6", "3 series", "a4 quattro", "q7", "fusion", "tt", "a4", "corolla", "a4 quattro"])

# Applying the function to the provided data
df_a4_filtered = audi_filter(df_cars)
```

The resulting DataFrame `df_a4_filtered` should contain only the rows where the manufacturer is Audi and the model is "a4" or "a4 quattro", with an additional column `audi_a4_type` that is set to `true` for all rows.
